title: How f(x) = 5x+3 .then show that f is a bijective function? - The Math Guru - Quora
tags: Middle and High School Math Homework Question

response.answer_text: Let x1 and x2 belong to the set A Then, f(x1) = f(x2) 5x1+3 = 5x2+3 5x1= 5x2 x1=x2 x1-x2 = 0 Therefore, this f(x) is one-one function because x1-x2 = 0 Now for onto fuction y= f(x) y= 5x+3 y-3= 5x x= y-3/5 Therefore the f(x) is onto function because there exists a pre-image of x for every value of y Hence, The function is bijective
